tasks: Climate model ensemble predictions of extreme risk
results: Comparative results for predicting extreme heat days
title:
A locally time-invariant metric for climate model ensemble predictions
  of extreme risk
abstract: Adaptation-relevant predictions of climate change are often derived by combining climate model simulations in a multi-model ensemble. Model evaluation methods used in performance-based ensemble weighting schemes have limitations in the context of high-impact extreme events. We introduce a locally time-invariant method for evaluating climate model simulations with a focus on assessing the simulation of extremes. We explore the behaviour of the proposed method in predicting extreme heat days in Nairobi and provide comparative results for eight additional cities.
